docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Two biotechnology companies - the Xoma Corporation and Centocor Inc. - are racing to bring to market a drug for treatment of septic shock, a condition caused by a bacterial infection often acquired in hospitals. Septic shock kills tens of thousands of people each year.

headline.main: Fight to Be First in Infection Drug

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: CONGRESS and the Reagan Administration are cracking down on physicians who refer patients to health-care companies in which the doctors have a financial interest.

headline.main: Business and Health; A Push to Restrict Profit on Referrals

docs.snippet: LEAD: CONGRESS and the Reagan Administration are cracking down on physicians who refer patients to health-care companies in which the doctors have a financial interest.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Despite its escalating war on drugs, New York City has failed to slow the growth of narcotics, and particularly crack, as a major source of crime, Mayor Koch said yesterday as he released his annual management report on the quality of city services.

headline.main: Increase in Drugs Impinges On City Services, Koch Says
